com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
Interface ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler<T,E>

public interface ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler<T,E>

This interface provides a callback handler definition and will be used by the card reader manager to notify the
calling application when a status update is available.
Unlike, many other callback handlers, the status update handler is unique; unlike a regular asynchronous call that
that notifies the caller once, this interface contains the APIs that will be invoked by the SDK to provide periodic
updates to the caller.
This interface is used specifically for the remote key update and software update workflow of the ChipAndPin based
card readerss
The update status handler has a well define flow: when the callback is registered while invoking the connectToDevice()
API, the caller will first be notified that the connection is initiated through the onInitiated() callback
If the connection was successful and no futher steps are necessary, then the onCompleted() callback will be invoked
and the updatedStatus parameter will reflect the current status
If an intermediate state is encountered - such as remote key update is required - then the onStatusUpdated callback
is invoked with the appropriate status code and display message
The caller is guaranteed to receive both the onInitiated and the onCompleted callbacks which is the final confirmation
of the status. The intermediate onStatusUpdated is optional is mainly useful as a utility to determine a meaningful UI
message to be displayed
